brief_summary.textblock:
There were many studies which examined the availability of inverted gray-scale chest X-ray
      for increasing the detection of lung nodules. In emergency medicine, rib fracture is an
      important part for patient's disposition, so investigators designed this study to evaluate
      the availability of inverted gray-scale chest X-ray for the detection of rib fracture.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Gray-scale Inverted Rib Series With Conventional Ones in Rib Fracture Detection by Emergency Physicians and Medical Students

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Emergency resident who want to participate

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Emergency resident who does not want to participate

primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of detection for rib fracture in 139 fracture of 55 patients
primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of detection for rib fracture

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
